abstract: Lufthansa says remains of 30 of 150 passengers who died in Germanwings plane crash in French Alps will be returned to relatives; announcement comes days after relatives of victims were told that death certificates issued by French authorities were invalid, which angered many of the families.
lead_paragraph: The announcement by the airline’s parent company ended uncertainty for the families after the transfer was suspended because of a bureaucratic error.

headline.main: Some Germanwings Victims’ Remains to Be Returned on Schedule
headline.print_headline: Some Remains From Germanwings Crash to Be Released

snippet: The announcement by the airline’s parent company ended uncertainty for the families after the transfer was suspended because of a bureaucratic error.
